intro: Hieracium acalephoides, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hieracium acalephoides is often found in disturbed soils and can spread vegetatively through its rhizomes.
